intro: Anthema arborea, commonly known as the tree anthem, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its woody stem and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom in the spring. Anthema arborea is typically found in moist, shaded areas of forests and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
